FOOTER

Working with my pair, we built this responsive website!

But beyond making kittens look cute at any size, what else did I learn? Well, I learned that to making a site responsive is fairly easy. First, you create a website (it's html) and then it's styling (css). Second, you add an '@media' tag to the stylesheet. Any element, classes, or ids that are nested inside the @media will become active when the @media conditions are fulfilled.

So, in this case, when you resize the browser down to a width of 480px or less, the @media tag conditions are fulfilled. Right then and there, the @media tag switches in the element-specific css styling. That's why you see the cat 'side-b' disappear and the 'padding-left' indented.
